chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah Mertens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and his supervision fees from 25% of his prison wages.  If not paid during Initial Incarceration, remainder to be paid during his period of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with controlled substances, except for those prescribed by a physician.
No contact with firearms.
Successfully complete any counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin Statutes.
The Court advised defendant that due to felony conviction defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail, defendant to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (24 pages) commencing 10-23-2015 SENTENCE HEARING received and filed.
Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Jeremiah Mertens in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jeremiah Mertens in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by both counsel.
As to count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 44 months in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for -0- days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 14 months and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 months, consecutive,  with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with controlled
        substances, except for those prescribed by a physician.
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and his 
        supervision fees from 25% of his prison wages, if not paid during initial incarceration, remainder to be paid during his period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
         Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment signed by the defendant and filed.  Copy given to the 
         defendant.                  
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin 
        statutes.
.
As to count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction, concurrent,  with -0- days credit.
.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, credit form, ineligible voting rights form.

Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Brookelynne B processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26209707 in court 1x on 6/17/15.

Original counts as charged in the complaint were Amended in the Information filed on 3/3/2015. Charges have been updated to reflect the changes (inclusion of the Habitual Criminality Repeater enhancer).

COUNT 1: Intentionally Contact Victim, Witness or Co-Actor After Court Order for a Felony Conviction, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 941.39(1), 973.055(1), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), 939.62(1)(b), a class H Felony.
COUNT 2: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(a),  a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), and 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(a), a class B Misdemeanor.

AS TO COUNT 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 3 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah Mertens in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jeremiah Mertens in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial.  Parties have reached a resolution of this matter.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
On motion of the State, pursuant to plea negotiations the Court ordered charge amended to REMOVE the Domestic Abuse Repeater enhancer 939.621(1)(b) and (2) and Habitual Criminality Repeater enhancer 939.62(1)(b).

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Jeremiah Mertens not in court, in custody. Kristin Schrank for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Final Pretrial held. Defense counsel advised court that defendant wishes to enter a plea in this matter. Court adjourned case for previously set Jury Trial date, court will accept plea on day of Trial. State advised the court that it's witnesses will be on call. Defense has up to 10 DAYS to respond to state's motion if desired. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 06/17/2015.

State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
